job_title: Senior Account Director in New York, NY
pros: Great people to work with, many folks have been in place 25-30 years. Product offering is good and industry leading, strong customer presence in North America.
cons: Changes in Sr leadership have resulted in a significant shift in control and oversight shifting from US CA to Europe. They have hired a number of legacy of Former ALU executives, most of which were responsible for the company’s decline prior to being acquired by Nokia. Lots of directed moves, cronyism, and lack of meritocracy is quickly pushing top talent out the door and there has been a flood of exits as folks evaluate their future in this environment. The company is heavily focused on profitability and driving profit specifically in North America as a result comp plans are exceedingly complex with lots of conflicting metrics. These same ALU executives provide limited to no guidance in the path forward on profitability instead choosing instead a passive aggressive approach to their teams in which their is a lot of hand waving and emotion and they essentially say they want high growth with high Margin and want you to go after everything. Accountability is driven at the customer team level with SR leaders getting a complete pass.
